chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: This is a download from BBC Learning English. To find out more, visit our website.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: Jane spent years living among families of wild chimpanzees.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: And of course, we'll be learning some related vocabulary along the way.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: When Gombe's alpha female died in 1972, she was so well loved that she had an obituary in the Times newspaper. But what was her name? That's our quiz question. Which chimpanzee's obituary appeared in the Times? Was it...

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: OK Sam, we'll find out later if you were right. Now, when Jane first visited Tanzania in the 1960s, most scientists believe the only animals capable of making and using tools were humans. But what Jane witnessed about the behaviour of one chimpanzee, who she named Greybeard, turned this idea on its head. Here, she recalls

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: that famous day to Jim Alcalili for the podcast of BBC Radio 4's discovery programme, The Life Scientific.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: Jane observed the chimpanzee Greybeard finding small wooden branches called twigs and modifying them, changing them slightly in order to improve them.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: Previously, it was believed that animals were incapable of making tools on their own. What Jane saw was proof of the intelligence of wild animals. Jane Goodall's studies convinced her that chimps experienced the same range of emotions as humans, as she explains here to BBC Radio 4's The Life Scientific.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: Holding hands, embracing and kissing were some of the chimpanzee's gestures. Movements made with hands, arms or head

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: to express ideas and feelings. In the same way as humans, the chimpanzees would pat each other, touch someone gently and repeatedly with their hand held flat.

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: Yes, Sam, you mean the quiz question I asked you earlier. Which chimpanzee had their obituary published in The Times? And I guessed it was Bee Flow. And that's absolutely right. Well done, Sam. Give yourself a pat on the back. Aha, OK. In this programme, we've been hearing about legendary zoologist and activist Jane Goodall and her experiences living among great apes. Primates like chimpanzees who are

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: humans' closest animal relatives. Jane witnessed the chimpanzees of Gombe modify, or slightly alter, objects like leaves and twigs to make tools – handheld instruments used for a particular job. Many of the chimpanzees' gestures – body movements made to communicate and express emotions like kissing and patting, touching someone gently and repeatedly with a flat hand – were almost human. And just like us, the chimps saw

chunks.episode_title: Do chimps have the same emotions as us_
chunks.chunk_text: physical contact to alleviate or reduce the severity of nervousness and stress. And that's all for this programme. Bye for now. Bye bye.
